title: Trump says alignment with BRICS’ ’anti-American policies’ to invite additional 10% tariffs
byline: US President Donald Trump on Sunday said that countries aligning themselves with the ’’Anti-American policies’’ of BRICS, will be charged an additional 10% tariff.

title: Former Minister Tiran Alles claims he receives death threats
byline: Former Public Security Minister Tiran Alles has reportedly received death threats via phone calls from an underworld gang leader based in Dubai.

title: Former top Sri Lankan civil servant Bradman Weerakoon passes away
byline: Deshamanya Bradman Weerakoon, a veteran Sri Lankan civil servant, has passed away at the age of 94, family sources confirmed.

title: Beira lake to become water aerodrome ?
byline: The Authorities have decided to look into the possibility of converting the Beira Lake into an aerodrome. An initial discussion has been held in this regard with the participation of Defense Secretary Air Vice Marshal Sampath Thuyacontha (Retd) at the Ministry of Defence recently to discuss the matter.

title: Renewable energy project cancellation : Adani tells Govt to reimburse initial cost
byline: The government, which scrapped the Adani renewable energy projects, is now under duress to reimburse a few million U.S. dollars incurred by the company here initially, Daily Mirror reliably learns.

title: Duminda Dissanayake further remanded
byline: Former Minister Duminda Dissanayake was today (07) further remanded until July 15 by the Mount Lavinia Magistrate’s Court in connection with the case involving the recent discovery of a gold-plated T-56 assault rifle.

title: ICC appoints Sanjog Gupta as its new CEO
byline: Indian media mogul Sanjog Gupta was on Monday (July 7) named the new Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of the Jay Shah-led International Cricket Council (ICC) following an elaborate recruitment process which began in March this year.

title: Election Commission services suspended
byline: The services of the Election Commission have been temporarily suspended from today (07) until further notice.

title: Speaker’s fuel allowance to be reduced
byline: It has been decided to reduce the fuel allowance granted to Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne to 900 liters and to make it in line with the fuel allowance given to a cabinet minister, Parliament Secretary General’s office said yesterday.

title: Police save four youths from drowning in Eththukala sea
byline: Four youths who were bathing in the sea off the Eththukala shore were saved by the Police Life Saving Unit last evening when they were being dragged away by strong currents.

title: Daughter of remanded neurosurgeon arrested
byline: The 21-year-old daughter of Dr. Maheshi Surasinghe Wijerathna, a consultant neurosurgeon attached to Sri Jayawardenapura General Hospital, has been arrested by the Keselwatta Police.

title: MP publishes pay sheet on his FB account and reveals all perks of MPs
byline: Opposition MP Jagath Vithana has published his pay sheet on Facebook and has thus become the only MP to do so.

title: Tiran Alles claims he receives death threats
byline: Former Public Security Minister Tiran Alles has reportedly received death threats via phone calls from an underworld gang leader based in Dubai.

title: Mujibur Rahman to be probed on container release affair?
byline: The Crimes Investigations Department (CID ) is expected to summon Samagi Jana Balawegaya ( SJB) Member of Parliament, Mujibur Rahman, to record a statement on the scam of releasing red-labelled containers.

title: Underworld was well-under control under Deshabandu: SB
byline: Former Minister S.B. Dissanayake said underwold activities in the country vanished soon after Acting IGP Deshabandu Tennakoon assumed duities.

title: Supreme Court informed of possible settlement in KDU MBBS admission petition
byline: The Supreme Court was informed by the relevant parties that the Fundamental Rights petition filed challenging the decision not to admit local students to the MBBS degree programme at the General Sir John Kotelawala Defence University (KDU) may be settled, as the university has now opened admissions to local students.

title: Doctor Maheshi’s daughter remanded
byline: Hemali Anithra Wijerathna, daughter of Dr. Maheshi was ordered to be remanded till July 9 on charges of issuing death threats to the Assistant Director and an investigating officer of the Bribery Commission, following the conclusion of a court case involving Dr. Maheshi.

title: Dasun Shanaka, Karunaratne return for Bangladesh T20Is
byline: Sri Lanka Cricket has named a 17-member squad for the upcoming T20 International series against Bangladesh, marking the return of former captain Dasun Shanaka and all-rounder Chamika Karunaratne to the national T20 setup.

title: Power and Energy Ministry to auction its luxury vehicles
byline: The Power and Energy Ministry has called for tenders to auction fourteen luxury vehicles including six Toyota Land Cruiser vehicles.

title: IRD seeks to tax non-resident service providers who surpass Rs. 60 million yearly threshold
byline: The Inland Revenue Department (IRD) has announced that all non-resident persons who provide services to customers in Sri Lanka through electronic platforms must register for Value Added Tax (VAT) if their earnings exceed a specified limit.

title: IRD Deputy Commissioner arrested for soliciting bribe
byline: An Inland Revenue Department (IRD) Deputy Commissioner has been arrested by the Bribery Commission for allegedly soliciting a bribe of Rs. 50,000 from a businessman.

title: Digital services that will be taxed 18% VAT announced
byline: A gazette notification has been issued announcing the list of digital services on which an 18 percent Value Added Tax (VAT) will be imposed with effect from October 01, 2025.

title: Sri Lanka, Belgium hold talks to boost port cooperation
byline: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Belgium, in collaboration with the Port of Antwerp-Bruges International (PoABI), organised a two-day fact-finding visit for a delegation from the Sri Lanka Ports Authority (SLPA) on June 23 and 24.

title: Expect more severe delays if Govt. doesn’t update e-commerce tax rules: Advocata
byline: Sri Lankan consumers and businesses making purchases from overseas online services could face further delays unless the government updates the country’s outdated e-commerce tax rules, the Advocata Institute has warned.

title: Wimal to release song in response to attacks on Palestine, Iran
byline: National Freedom Front (NFF) leader Wimal Weerawansa is set to release a new song he has written in response to the recent airstrikes on Iran and the ongoing violence against Palestinians.

title: Politics and Egos plague Sri Lanka Rugby: Murcott
byline: When Richard Murcott, 42, moved to Germany, he believed his days on the rugby sidelines were behind him. Having previously coached in Sri Lanka and Dubai, the veteran coach was ready to step away from the game and settle into a quieter life — tending to his dogs and leaving the whistle behind. But fate had other plans.

title: Govt. will have to subject itself to a probe to find truth over Easter Sunday attacks: Prez
byline: The government will have to subject itself to a probe (Rajayata Rajayama Parikshanayakata Bajanaya karanna wenawa) to uncover the truth behind Easter Sunday attacks, and it is a challenging task, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today.

title: CSE slides as investors await USA tariff decision
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed the trading day on a negative note. As the new week commenced, the market experienced a decline, with investors engaging in profit-taking throughout the session.
